LanguageData.CokeFurnace_Started: The furnace is active. Disable it by right-clicking the selected colonists.
LanguageData.CokeFurnace_IngInfo:
Required item to create {0}.

{1} is required in the amount of {2} (loaded {3}).
Select a colonist and right-click on the furnace and select the ingredient to load.
LanguageData.CokeFurnace_ResultInfo: As a result, you will get {0} in the amount of {1} pcs.\n\nTo start coking, load the necessary ingredients into the furnace, then select the colonist, right-click on the furnace and select 'Set fire'. Progress can be seen below.
LanguageData.MustPlaceOnGasWell: Can only be built on a gas well.
LanguageData.GasPlant_ActiveInfoOFF: Not active. There is no gas coolers or power.
LanguageData.GasCooler_ActiveInfoNoTankers: \nThere are no pipes leading to the gas tankers
LanguageData.QuestTimeout: Time to complete the quest {0} has expired
LanguageData.SupportFullDoomsday: Help is fully staffed. You can not recruit more factions.
LanguageData.DiscussWithOtherFactions: Discuss the event with other factions.
LanguageData.DoomsdayDesc: The {0} faction has acquired an Archotech Doomsday weapon and demand a ransom payment. We can try to gather enough silver to meet their demands, or maybe other factions will be able to help conduct a raid on their base?
LanguageData.RelationsWithPlayer: Relation with player: {0} ({1}) Trust in the player: {2}
LanguageData.Help_AskResouces: The {0} faction answers the call for aid and sends you what resources they could. {1}
LanguageData.Help_AskPower: The faction {0} answers the call to arms and sends you a group of fighters to support your settlement.
LanguageData.UsingCaravan: The faction technology does not allow it to use cargo pods, they have sent a caravan by land.
LanguageData.UsingCapsules: Support was sent by cargo pods.
LanguageData.GiftHasBeenDropped: Resources have been dropped close to your colony.
LanguageData.AssistCaravan_GifterArrived: A friendly squad arrived at your request. They will leave things near your colony.
LanguageData.ClimateBombDesc: We've discovered the location of an armed climate bomb. Who built it and why it was left on this planet is not clear, but we need to neutralize it. If we don't and allow it to detonate, the next few seasons will be very chaotic. \n\nWe need to assemble a strong combat force, there will likely be enemies defending it.
LanguageData.Comm_MassiveFireDesc: A forest fire has been spotted raging near our settlement and it is spreading quickly, threatening nearby territories including our own. \nWe can hope for rain or try to put it out ourselves.
LanguageData.Comm_ShipCrashDesc: A space ship was spotted breaking apart in atmosphere. It appears to be general purpose traveler's ship. Segments of the ship separate and diverge onto their own crash courses, likely cargo and living compartments of various sizes. \nThe ship's parts have scattered all over the planet. Ship plating is often constructed with plasteel and may have left some of the contents intact. You can travel to the crash sites and attempt to salvage what you can, but many others will have also seen the crash and will surely want to claim some of it for themselves.
LanguageData.Comm_SiegeCampDesc: Not far from us a camp of rogue militants is spotted. They can be seen building long range mortars directed towards us. They will attack us in short intervals, simultaneously fortifying their position and increasing their combat power. We need to destroy them as soon as possible, before they become too big of a problem.
LanguageData.EmailMessageReceived: You have received a message from {0} on the topic {1}. You can view it via the Geoscape Mailbox.
LanguageData.ScoutingComp_InfoTitle: Greetings, I am sending you information our intelligence officers have gathered for your settlement. The report indicates possible dangers and estimated time until occurence.\n\n
LanguageData.ScoutingComp_NoThreatsInfoTitle: Greetings, our field scounts have finally returned. They did not detect any looming threats.
LanguageData.CommOption_SubscribeScout_SubTitle:
Intelligence agreement

By signing the agreement, the faction with which it was signed will share any relevant intelligence reports via Geoscape Mailbox which may contain information on impending threats
LanguageData.CommOption_SubscribeScout_SubAlready: [Agreement has already been signed: {0} days to go]
LanguageData.QuestPawn_Title: Greetings! What would you like to discuss?
LanguageData.TakeQuestFromPawnLetterDesc: You have taken the quest "{0}". Additional information on the task can be seen in the Geoscape.\n----------------\n{1}
LanguageData.CommOption_PawnOfferYes: You have accepted the offer. The settler {0} has joined your colony. Relations with the {1} faction are also improved.
LanguageData.ActualOnlyThisMap: The offer is relevant while the guest is with you.
LanguageData.CommunicationDialog_Pocahontas: You did not accept the co-residence proposal. Seeing this as an insult, your relationship with the {0} faction has been reduced.
LanguageData.Quest_KillLeaderDesc: The enemy leader is dead, you can form a caravan to leave.
LanguageData.LeaderStillAlive: The enemy leader is still alive. ({0})
LanguageData.Quest_KillOrderDesc: You have completed the contract, eliminating {0}.
LanguageData.CommOption_NonAgressionPact_Success: A Non-Aggression Pact with faction {0} has been signed. Your negotiator's skill level {1} allowed them to reach a deal for a duration of {2} days. During this time, the faction {0} will not raid your settlement.
LanguageData.NonAfressionPackComp: The Non-Aggression Pact with the faction {0} is over. Now they may attack you again.
LanguageData.Alliance_PlayerAlreadyHaveOne: You already have an alliance; you can’t establish a few.
LanguageData.GlobalFactionManager_NewAllianceDesc: Fraction {0} founded an alliance whose goal {1}
LanguageData.CommOption_InviteToAlliance_NoAlliance: You do not have an active alliance
LanguageData.CommOption_InviteToAlliance_Wait: The faction is not ready for negotiations. Wait more {0} days.
LanguageData.CommOption_InviteToAlliance_NeedAAlly: Friendship or Neutrality Required to Invite a Faction to the Alliance
LanguageData.CommOption_InviteToAlliance_NeedTrust: The faction’s confidence level is too low for them to join your alliance. (minimum required {0})
LanguageData.TrustFactionInformation: The level of trust shows how much the faction trusts you. Confidence can be enhanced by successfully completing fractions.
LanguageData.CommOption_InviteToAlliance_AnyHostileIn: Your alliance has a faction (s) that are at odds with this.
LanguageData.Alliance_AddFactionDesc: After negotiations, the faction {0} joins your alliance.
LanguageData.Alliance_RemoveFactionDesc: Fraction {0} leaves the alliance for a reason: {1} All current agreements were broken.
LanguageData.Alliance_Quest_ResearchSharing_StartedDe: You have arrived at your destination. Exchange of experience will take 2 days, after which you will receive research points and your colonist.
LanguageData.TradeSchedulingAgreementWindow_SelectFac: Select the faction with which the agreement will be concluded.
LanguageData.Alliance_CanSignAgreement_NoTargetGoal: Unable to enter into alliance current goal
LanguageData.TradeSchedulingAgreementWindow_SelectIte: Select items for agreement. When concluding an agreement, a standard discount of 20% is used (the price is already formatted). You can increase the discount by up to 50% by investing in trust.
LanguageData.TradeSchedulingAgreementWindow_CaravanDe: Delivery method: caravan. Travel time of the caravan from the settlement to you takes {0} days.
LanguageData.TradeSchedulingAgreementWindow_CapsuleDe: Delivery method: capsules. No extra time required.
LanguageData.TradeSchedulingAgreement_CreateSucessDes: You have signed an agreement with the faction {0}. Goods worth {1} silver will be delivered from {2} via {3} days.
LanguageData.Alliance_CanSignAgreement_MinMembersRequ: not enough members in the alliance ({0} required)
LanguageData.TradeSchedulingAgreementCompProperties_S: current negotiator cannot make an agreement, choose another
LanguageData.TradeSchedulingAgreementComp_CaravanForm: An allied caravan is formed and sent to you.
LanguageData.MakeWarWindow_EmptyName: The name of the war is required
LanguageData.War_WarIsStartedDesc: The faction {0} ({1}) started the war with {2} ({3}) called {4}. Her goal is {5}
LanguageData.CommOption_InviteToAlliance_InWar: You are at war with this faction
LanguageData.MakeWarWindow_DrawDefendModeCantTruce: It is impossible to conclude a peace treaty now. Wait a while.
LanguageData.CommOption_MakeWar_InAlliance: You cannot declare war on a member of your alliance
LanguageData.CommOption_SubscribeScout_CantSub: You cannot sign an agreement because you are at war with a faction
LanguageData.CommOption_NonAgressionPact_CantSign: You cannot sign an agreement because you are at war with a faction
LanguageData.WarGoalWorker_Destruction_YouWinDesc: You won the war {0}, destroying all the enemy settlements, which earned additional trust in the eyes of your allies.
LanguageData.WarGoalWorker_Destruction_YouLoseDesc: You lost the war {0} because you lost absolutely all your settlements. The game is over.
LanguageData.CaravanArrivalAction_AIAttackSettlement_: The enemy army {0} is advancing, take a position!
LanguageData.DefenseContractCompProperties_FactionTec: The fraction level {0} is too low ({1}) to use transport capsules. (minimum of {2} required)
LanguageData.DefenseContractCompWindow_LowTechLevel: (the level of development of the fraction is insufficient)
LanguageData.DefenseContractCompWindow_CreatedDesc: Within {0} days, if you are attacked, faction {1} will send reinforcements to you.
LanguageData.DefenseContractComp_HelpDesc: {0} send help! They will leave in 1 day
LanguageData.DefenseContractComp_EndDesc: The duration of the defensive contract with {0} has come to an end. They will no longer send help in case of an attack on you
LanguageData.SupernovaExp_low: Several hundred thousand light-years, a supernova explosion occurred. It will not cause any harm and will be visible from all over the planet, which will allow you to watch a beautiful sight
LanguageData.SupernovaExp_medium: Several tens of thousands of light years away, a supernova explosion occurred. Expect a small meteor shower and an increase in temperature.
LanguageData.SupernovaExp_high: Several thousand light years away, a supernova explosion occurred. Expect heavy meteor showers, a very strong temperature increase and long days.
LanguageData.SupernovaExp_ultra: Several hundred light-years, a supernova explosion occurred. Expect heavy meteor showers, long days, a very strong temperature increase. Also, an explosion is likely to destroy part of the atmosphere.
LanguageData.ShipPartTimeout: \nProbably the wreckage will be looted in (days):
LanguageData.EnemyOnTheMap: There are still enemies on the map. You can not form a caravan now.
LanguageData.SuccessDisarmingDesc: The climate bomb was cleared successfully. In the dismantling process, an element was found that seems to be the main source of energy. Your colonists were able to steal it. With it, you me be able to create a new source of energy.
LanguageData.DefusingInfo:
Attempt to disarm the bomb.

Your colonists report that trying to defuse the bomb is likely to send an alert signal that will attract a large defense force.

Get ready for battle!
LanguageData.ZeroPointReactorDestablishedDesc: The zero point reactor has destabilized and is about to fail. The vacuum core is pulling in nearby creatures!
LanguageData.YourAttackWasRepelledDesc: Your attack on the enemy camp failed. They will likely rebuild their defenses and the surviving colonists are probably dead or to be sold into slavery.
LanguageData.AttackIsNotRepelled: You can not leave now. The attack is not yet repelled.
LanguageData.AttackFriendlySettlementLetter1: A scout from the friendly settlement {0} reports that one of the enemy settlements is preparing an attack on them. They ask you for help. Unfortunately, the level of threat is not known. (To help the settlement, send a caravan to it and repel the attack)
LanguageData.AttackFriendlySettlementLetter2: A scout from the friendly settlement {0} reports that one of the enemy settlements is preparing an attack on them. They ask you for help. Threat Level: {1} (To help the settlement, send a caravan to it and repel the attack)
LanguageData.AttackedFriendlySettlementDefendHelp: You have arrived. Set up a defense, the settlers here are at your disposal. Remember that you need to save as many lives as possible!
LanguageData.AttackedFriendlySettlementDefendVictory:
You fended off the attack.
{0} Thank you. You were able to save {1} settlers, for which you get a reward:
 {2} 

 You can pick it up when you form a caravan.
LanguageData.AttackedFriendlySettlementDefendLoseWith: You fought off the attack, but you could not save a single friendly settler.\nYou simply have no one to give a reward, and all that will remain here is a ruin.
LanguageData.AttackedFriendlySettlementLoseWithoutHel: You didn’t help settlement {0}, your relationship has lowered.
LanguageData.NotEnoughSpace: Not enough space for armor. Free up more space around the station.
LanguageData.NoArmorInStation: Station is not active. Missing armor.
LanguageData.WeaponDeactivated: The Doomsday weapon has been deactivated
LanguageData.PlanetWillBeDestroyed: The planet will be destroyed in (days):
LanguageData.RansomComplete: The enemy commander laughs loudly over the radio. So be it, they will not blow up the planet. The laughter subsides as they quickly pack up and disappear without a trace. Perhaps this is not the end.
LanguageData.PlanetDestroyed: At once everyone covers their ears in pain. It is as if a million lightning bolts struck in the same place at once - a small artificial star is born just beyond the world's atmosphere. Everyone stumbles as the planet begins to move, plunging into blinding orb of light. As the last remnants of hope shatter, so too does the planet's surface, cracks of the world's molten blood erupt and spread across the surface like crimson rivers. The apocalyptic machine emits a column of bright light, a leash leading the planet to its grave. The atmosphere ignites in a cleansing flame that provides a quick death, perhaps quicker than is truly deserved. The fragments of this broken world will be an everlasting monument to the folly of man. While most others in the universe will see it as a lesson, some may see it as potential.
LanguageData.DoomsdayEnterSiteHelp: You have come to an enemy base. Somewhere hidden doomsday weapon. It must be found, de-energized and destroyed, but first you have to clear the base.
LanguageData.ShildsOffDommsday: You were able to turn off the energy barrier protecting the device. Now you need to disable the final security system.
LanguageData.DoomsdayTerminal_LogginFail: Failed login attempt. Check username and password.
LanguageData.DoomsdayTerminal_UsersHack:
Activation module HackTools 1.0\nActivation successful.\nSearch for vulnerabilities ... Found an administrative email. Decryption email ...
From: ExFeral To: AktunOba
It seems the boss is still going to use the weapon for blackmail. Hell, he's gonna blow this world up. Of course I'm not against scoring heap of silver, but I also live here! I tried to persuade him to be rational, but his greed is driving him crazy. I want to play it safe if in case things get out of hand, but I can't just write out the password here and risk someone else finding this letter. The password is the answer to this riddle, one I've told you many times, you should have no problems solving it. "You enter a dark kitchen with no power. There is a candle, a kerosene lamp, and a gas stove. What will you light first?" One word. Use it to log in as Feral.
LanguageData.DoomsdayTerminal_AlreadyLogged: You are already logged in. Use /logout.
LanguageData.DoomsdayTerminal_SecurityFirst: Enter the security password. /security *password* *(5$#LKki*6 HackTools 1.0 --> Memory dump /security dump ^I21%$$*1%p0rfgw
LanguageData.DoomsdayTerminal_HackToolsSecurity: Inject HackTools 1.0 --> Meta OK --> Memory OK --> Memory dump...
LanguageData.DoomsdayTerminal_SecurityAccessGranted: Security System Access Granted. Commands: --> /security disable --> /security enable
LanguageData.DoomsdayTerminal_SecurityNoPower: Power is off, deactivation of protection systems is not possible.
LanguageData.DoomsdayTerminal_SecurityPowerInfoPassiv:
Welcome to the energy management section.
-->Energy shield: inactive -->Power: off
RETROS BIOS-4.02.000 T2EE5/E7.E8 Root (5A8)
RUN IN PASSIVE MODE, TO DISABLE --> /security energy activemode
LanguageData.DoomsdayTerminal_ActiveModeEnable:
Enabling Active Mode ...
ExplasaSystems 5.3 (BG/SS5 FastUse 13.2) Energy RETROS RBIOS-4.02.000 T2EE5/E7.E8 ... ... Initializing user mode ... Activating internal systems ... Systems are active.
RUN IN ACTIVE MODE
LanguageData.DoomsdayTerminal_SecurityPowerInfoActive:
Welcome to the energy management section.
-->Energy shield: inactive -->Power: off
RETROS RBIOS-4.02.000 T2EE5/E7.E8 Root (5A8)
RUN IN ACTIVE MODE COMMANDS: --> /security energy shields --> /security energy on
LanguageData.DoomsdayTerminal_PowerActivating: Switching magnetic resistors --> OK Redirecting energy to the control shaft --> OK
LanguageData.SecurityDoomsdayOff: You were able to disable the security systems of doomsday weapon. Now you can safely destroy it.
LanguageData.GameCondition_SpaceBattleTitle: A space battle is occuring in low orbit, watch out for debris.
LanguageData.Building_TribalCrack_OptionInactive: Impossible to destroy, the selected colonist has no grenades.
LanguageData.Building_TribalCrack_Option: Go down the tunnel and blow it up
LanguageData.TribalCrack_InfoDesc: The settler {0} went into the tunnel. Planting a bomb and exploding will take about {1} days. At this time, the settler will be unavailable.
LanguageData.Building_TribalCrack_Desc: {0} destroyed the tunnel connecting you with the Tribal settlement.
LanguageData.Building_TribalCrack_DoDestroyAction: Fill up the hole with your hands
LanguageData.CompChargeableWeapon_ChargeDesc: The charge of the item. When it ends, the item will lose most of its strength.
LanguageData.Fair_EndDesc: The fair has been completed, thanks for participating!
LanguageData.NotEnoughtSkillForComp: There are no settlers with a sufficient skill level in the caravan
LanguageData.Competitions_WinnerDesc:
The {0} faction represented by {2} won the {0} competition. He won with a score of {3}.
The reward was {4} silver and a rewarding experience to skill.
LanguageData.Competitions_JustEndDesc: Competition in {0} is over. You did not attend.
LanguageData.Competitions_EnterToCompetitionsDesc:
Competitions begin!
The competition lasts 3 days, every day you will receive statistics where you can track the place of your representative in the score table
LanguageData.Competitions_AlreadyPaid: You have already bribed the judges
LanguageData.Competitions_JudgPaidDesc: You have successfully bribed the judges. This will give you an extra 7 points.
LanguageData.Competitions_NeedToStartForPaid: First you need to come to the competition
LanguageData.Competitions_JudgePaidFailDesc: As a result of the inspection of the judges, it turned out that you bribed them. This will worsen relations with participating factions..
LanguageData.CaravanArrivalAction_TransferPrisoners_S: ЗPrisoner {0} successfully transferred. {1} paid you {2} (sent to your base)
LanguageData.Quest_PrisonShipAccident_NCDesc: You did not capture a single prisoner, they most likely have already scattered across the planet.
LanguageData.CaravanBattlePlacePlace_BattleDescriptio: Your caravan {0} has fought with {1}. If you leave the map, you will be considered losers and some of your settlers may be killed when trying to escape. The victory will be considered the complete destruction of the enemy forces.
LanguageData.CaravanBattlePlacePlace_Battle_WinnerAID: The enemy won in this battle
LanguageData.CaravanBattlePlacePlace_Battle_WinnerPla: You were able to defeat the enemy and win the battle!
LanguageData.CaravanBattlePlacePlace_Deserting: {0} was killed while escaping from the battlefield
LanguageData.HowToCheckReqList: To view a list of required items, open detailed information.
LanguageData.HelpResourcesDescriptionTitle:
Faction {0} requested resources. We need to send a caravan with the necessary supplies to this point in order to deliver them.
List of required resources:
LanguageData.GiveItemsSuccess: You have successfully delivered the requested resources. The reward was sent to your base via cargo pods.
LanguageData.GiveItemsSuccess2: You have successfully delievered the resources. The award was given to your caravan.
LanguageData.Quest_HelpItems_Description: The leader of the {0} faction contacts you and tells you that they are going to expand their settlement, but they don’t have enough available resources. They request some resources from you and in exchange they will give what supplies they have in abundance. \nWe can form a caravan with the necessary items and send it to them.
LanguageData.HowToGivePawns: To assist the settlement, send a caravan with the required number of pawns ({0}) to the construction site. \nConstruction time: {1}
LanguageData.Quest_BuildNewBase_Description: The faction {0} is requesting aid in moving one of their settlements. They explain that their current location has run low on natural resources and poor soil fertility has rendered is unsustainable. They have enough supplies stockpiled, but do not have enough capable construction workers and request that you send assistance. \n\nConstruction may take several days and during this time your colonists will be unavailable. Upon completion of construction you will be rewarded and your colonists will be returned.
LanguageData.NotEnoughPawnsToHelp: Not enough colonistss in the caravan
LanguageData.HelpStarted: Your caravan has arrived at the construction site of the new settlement. According to preliminary calculations, construction will take {0} days, after which your colonists will be returned.
LanguageData.BuildingSeccessEnd: Construction of the settlement for {0} is over. They are grateful and inform you that they will be willing to return the favor by providing supplies or military aid. (You can make requests through the Geoscape)
LanguageData.Quest_AttackFriendlySettlement_Descripti:
The leader of the {0} allied faction {1} reports that their scouts have spotted an approaching enemy raid on their settlement. They explain that most of their fighters are away on a classified mission and request combat assistance. 
If you help them repel this attack, they will be able to provide you with intelligence information from time to time. 

To help repel the attack, form a caravan with everything you need and head to the rally point on the map. 
The reward depends on the number of surviving settlers of the allied settlement.
LanguageData.ScoutComp_Give: You have signed an intelligence agreement with the {0} faction. They will provide intelligence data every {1} days for {2} days that may contain information about imminent threats, but warn that it may not always be completely accurate.
LanguageData.ScoutComp_AlreadyGive: An intelligence agreement with faction {0} has already been signed, so it has been extended for {1} days.
LanguageData.Quest_MissingPeople_Description: The leader of the faction {0} contacted us and reported that a small group of their settlers went on a journey to gather resources but has not returned. Their journey was estimated to take {1} days, but more than {2} days have already passed. Attempts to get in touch have failed and they are worried that the settlers might have gotten lost or been attacked. \nThey should enough food for about {3} days, after which they will starve. He asks us to find the missing settlers and return them home.
LanguageData.Quest_MissingPeople_InspectString: Potential place for lost settlers. \nFood will run out in: {0} (days)
LanguageData.Quest_MissingPeople_InspectString2: House of missing settlers. \nTime to deliver settlers: {0} (days)
LanguageData.Quest_MissingPeople_CheckFail: We've find signs of the missing settlers, but nobody is here. There are fresh tracks leading away from the site, we should follow them. (A new destination is marked on the map)
LanguageData.Quest_MissingPeople_EnterToMap: Entering the territory we quickly spot the small camp of missing settlers. They are weak, but not ready to give up. While preparing to leave, a group of hostiles appear on the horizon. We will have to fight our way out and protect the settlers we came to rescue.
LanguageData.Quest_MissingPeople_Stage2Title: Caravan formed and ready to move
LanguageData.Quest_MissingPeople_Stage2: We were able to repel the attack, now we must escort the settlers home within {0} days. If we do not deliver them in time, we will be condemned as scavenging thieves taking advantage of the situation. (Take the caravan to the marked settlement base)
LanguageData.Quest_MissingPeople_End: You arrived at the Allied settlement.\n
LanguageData.Quest_MissingPeople_EndFull: \nYou managed to bring all the settlers alive, for which the faction {0} is very grateful to you.
LanguageData.Quest_MissingPeople_EndPart: \nYou tell the story of what difficulties you faced, that those who died did not do so in vain and the rest should be proud of them.
LanguageData.Quest_MissingPeople_Fiasko: \nYou came with nothing but excuses. The leader of the {0} faction is very upset. You try to explain, but with nothing to show for it they simply shake their head and walk away.
LanguageData.Quest_MissingPeople_Thief: You did not return the surviving settlers in time, those that were rescued left you to return on their own. They told their leader about this and he accused you of harboring the settlers against their will. The agreement between you has been broken.
LanguageData.Quest_KillLeader_CardLabel: Order to kill an enemy leader
LanguageData.Quest_KillLeader_Description: {0} talks about the enemy leader-dictator {1} from faction {2}, who has made threats against their settlement and asks you to eliminate them. Your target's location is marked on the world map. News of an assassination attempt will not stay secret for long and will spread quickly, you must strike soon.
LanguageData.Quest_SuppressionRebellion_Description: The faction {0} has problems with rebellion from within. The insurgents demand independence and have commited reckless and volent acts for their cause, resulting in civilian fatalities. The soldiers of {0} faction were able to push them from the settlement, but they are gaining strength and will attack again. We can help suppress insurgency or stand aside and let the conflict resolve itself. In the end, if the rebels win, a new faction will be formed.
LanguageData.Quest_SuppressionRebellion_Dia:
You have entered the territory. In the distance you see a group of insurgents preparing to attack.
You can complete the quest in two ways.
You can do kill all the insurgents. In this case, you can salvage whatever supplies are lef tin the camp. Or you can try to incapacitate as many as possible, they are still under the jurisdiction of the {0} faction. You will be rewarded for doing so.
In any case, the task will be considered successful.
LanguageData.Quest_SuppressionRebellionDesc: The attempt to suppress the insurgency was unsuccessful and they were able to defeat you. They will have already gone to attempt their coup, the outcome is no longer in your hands.
LanguageData.Quest_SuppressionRebellionRebelWinDesc: The insurgents were able to defeat the soldiers from the settlement {0}. {1} This led to a change of leadership and a new political regime has taken over.
LanguageData.Quest_SuppressionRebelplayerAffect: The insurgents will remember that your settlement tried to stop them, because of that your relationship has worsened.
LanguageData.Quest_SuppressionRebelNonplayerAffect: Your settlement did not participate in this.
LanguageData.Quest_SuppressionRebellionNewFactionDesc: The rebels could not defeat the {0}, the rebellious survivors formed their own splinter faction and called themselves {1}
LanguageData.Quest_KillOrder_Description: {0} requests to eliminate {1} from {2} faction for silver. He marked the target's location on the world map.
LanguageData.UseNewMapSizes: Activate additional world sizes (game reload required)
LanguageData.MinParts: Minimum generated parts scattered around the map
LanguageData.MaxParts: Maximum generated parts scattered around the map
LanguageData.ShipCargo_Food_MinSupply: Minimum generated parts scattered around the map
LanguageData.ShipCargo_Food_MaxSupply: Maximum generated parts scattered around the map
LanguageData.ShipCargo_Complex_MinSupply: Minimum generated parts scattered around the map
LanguageData.ShipCargo_Complex_MaxSupply: Maximum generated parts scattered around the map
LanguageData.ShipCargo_Armory_MinSupply: Minimum generated parts scattered around the map
LanguageData.ShipCargo_Armory_MaxSupply: Maximum generated parts scattered around the map
LanguageData.ShipCargo_Living_MinSupply: Minimum generated parts scattered around the map
LanguageData.ShipCargo_Living_MaxSupply: Maximum generated parts scattered around the map
LanguageData.DoMapChange_title: Change biomes to the desert gradually (1/0)
LanguageData.DoMapChange: If active (1), then every few days random tiles will change their biome to the desert
